author: Special Correspondent
text:
School students take out a rally in connection with Jipmer's 'Sanitation Fortnight.'-Photo: Special Arrangement

PUDUCHERRY: Jawaharlal Institute of Post Graduate Medical Education and Research (Jipmer) is observing a sanitation fortnight to raise awareness about maintaining environmental hygiene, through various programmes.

The awareness drive was launched with a rally by NSS Students from St. Patrick School, Saradhanbal Nagar, Puducherry highlighting the importance of hospital sanitation and personal hygiene. Acting Director S. Mahadevan flagged off the rally.

Jipmer has also put up posters and banners at prominent places detailing do’s and don’ts for the patients and attenders. Handbills on personal hygiene, hospital sanitation and environmental sanitation are also being distributed among the patients and attenders. A special cleaning drive in Kendriya Vidyalaya involving fogging to reduce the mosquito breeding on the campus was also carried out.

A health talk on hospital-acquired infection and a source reduction camp to keep the Jipmer campus mosquito-free are also part of the activities.

On the concluding day on February 29, a street play has been planned to create awareness of sanitation and personal hygiene among the patient and attenders opposite WCH Block.
title: Jipmer sends a ‘clean’ message
